passages.text:
You are standing at a fork in the road. In front of you is three ways to go: To the left to a quaint little Hamlet, to the right a foreboding Fortress, and lastly the way from whence you came. 

[[Go North->Fork]]
[[Go East->The Fortress]]
[[Go South->Homestead]]
[[Go West->Hamlet]]
passages.name: Fork

passages.text:
The fortress looms above you, it's impassable stone face stares deeply into your soul. Having seen this fortress upclose for the first time in your life, being this close has finally let it have an effect on you. You cannot muster the courage to go inside it.

Yet you must. After a few moments of collecting your thoughts, you decide to go forward.

Before you lies two equally broad oak doors, complete with black steel trim. Both doors are seemingly unguarded and both have their own respective drawbridges with a moat. The doors are equidistant from you and there is one to your Left, and one to your Right.

Of course, if you decide once and and for all you really can't do it, you can return to the Fork in the road.

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Fortress]]
[[Go East->The Right Door]]
[[Go South->The Fork?]]
[[Go West->The Left Door]]
passages.name: The Fortress

passages.text:
The way back only leads to your small farmstead, from which your adventure began! Unfortunately, that means the only way you can go is forward.

[[Go North->Fork]]
[[Go East->Fork]]
[[Go South->Fork]]
[[Go West->Fork]]
passages.name: Homestead

passages.text:
The ruined Hamlet appears before you. Destroyed ruins and the bodies of your fellow countrymen come into view, as does the visage of some grisly and dark-bodied creatures. 

You know those faces, and yet decide that today is not the day to become a hero...

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Fork?]]
[[Go East->The Fork?]]
[[Go South->The Fork?]]
[[Go West->The Fork?]]
passages.name: Hamlet

passages.text:
As you step onto the wooden bridge on the right, the gate starts to rise before you.

From which out steps a gigantic dragon, with flames dancing around it's maw. A single scale on the beast is the size of your hand, and it's color blazes a red so much more crimson yet still more vibrant then the color of your own blood.

Speaking of your blood, how would you know the color of such a thing? You've never seen someone bleed in your life, as such is the life of a farmhand, that is unti- oh right, that is until you looked down.

Before your gaze is a gaping hole where your heart should be. Your hands now covered in the previously unfamiliar substance. The dragon had gone for the kill as soon as it's prey entered it's sight, as this noble brute has no humanesque lunacy in messing with it's food.

As your body slumps to the ground and the numbness comes racing towards your cold face, the only thing you can see is the blurry vision of the dragon. It stares at you with something that seems like... pity? However, the dragon quickly recovers, and turning it's head towards you, the jaw whispers alight with flame, letting it bellow out one last beautiful sight. A parting gift to you...

And roasted dinner for it.

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go East->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go South->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go West->The Bad Ending]]
passages.name: The Right Door

passages.text:
As you approach the left door you feel something start to itch along your arms as soon as you step on it's bridge.

The itching starts to increase in frequency, and so you start to return in kind. An itch here, a scratch there, nothing is stopping you from getting to that door.

However, you only make it partway across the bridge until your hands are unable to keep up. You stop as you realize this itching can't be good. 

As you soon as you stop itching the itch flares across your body, streaks of skin now denegated to be scratched like sandpaper. OH how the itching burns! It burns deep within your skin! 

Actually, in a brief moment of clairty you realize you aren't just itching, you're actually burning! 

This bridge must be magically protected from unwanted outsiders, Population: You! 

You realize this too late and attempt to jump for the moat but not before the flesh drops from your bone as you outstrech your arm. The spell has taken it's hold, it's too late now. No amount of water could help you.

You resign yourself to your fate, the last of your thoughts wondering if more could have been done?

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go East->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go South->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go West->The Bad Ending]]
passages.name: The Left Door

passages.text:
You are standing at a fork in the road. In front of you is three ways to go: To the left, soot and ash wafts into your face, as you can see the flames they belong to roar ferociously. The previously quaint little Hamlet is ablaze. 

If you go this way it could take some time for the flames to die down and for any unsaviory characters to disappear, IF they disapppear...

Still, to the right is the foreboding Fortress, and lastly there is the way from whence you came. 



[[Go North->The Fork?]]
[[Go East->The Fortress]]
[[Go South->Homestead 2]]
[[Go West->Hamlet 2]]
passages.name: The Fork?

passages.text:
The ruined Hamlet appears before you. Destroyed ruins and the bodies of your fellow countrymen come into view, as does the visage of some grisly and dark-bodied creatures, again. 

The faces of your fellow deceased villagers play out repeatedly in your mind as you watch one of the animals feast upon it's meal. You decide that today is not the day to become a hero...

That is until you do! Or at least you want to! 

You've already backed down once... You can't just let it all go away twice! Can you?! 

Do you care to proceed forward or do you let sleeping dogs lie?

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->Hamlet 3]]
[[Go East->The Fork?]]
[[Go South->Hamlet 3]]
[[Go West->Hamlet 3]]
passages.name: Hamlet 2

passages.text:
The way back only leads to your small farmstead, surrounded by thick brush and forestry. This is from which your adventure began! Unfortunately, that means the only way you can go is forward.

That would be if you could... Before you stands a bulwark of a beast blocking your path forward. You recognize the telltale signs from your childhood fairytales. A black slithery creature with indiscernable features that seem to impossibly shift before your very eyes...

A Ghualloc.

While you could run, you won't make it very far. 

This does not bode well...

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go East->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go South->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go West->The Bad Ending]]
passages.name: Homestead 2

passages.text:
One way or another, you have met your end.

With the end of your journey, the world is doomed to persist in a ruined state. Though, perhaps... another adventurer could take up your mantle..?

Perhaps, that other adventurer is... you? However, this time, you will not be you, cannot be you. It's time to be the hero that's needed in this world.

This time, it's time to save the world!

[[Go North->The Fork.]]
[[Go East->The Fork.]]
[[Go South->The Fork.]]
[[Go West->The Fork.]]
passages.name: The Bad Ending

passages.text:
Despite every voice in your head screaming at you to abandon your fellow peasants to their fate, you still step forward.

And step forward you do, charging at the macabre of mugs that turn towards you. Letting out a defiant yell, you will not let these Ghuallocs take the presumably last one of you without a fight. 

You're a citizen of the Armaed Empire after all, and no Armaedi citizen should die without a smile on his face, and with all his regrets on the battlefield. That smile having been earned through one's own strife and hardwork in the battle they die.

Unfortunately for you, you gain nothing special in being an Armaedi citizen either. The beasts quickly get over their shock from a rarely defiant one such as yourself, and soon pile upon you in seconds. All you can see is a mixture of bone and sinew as your try to claw away your attackers to no avail. 

After all, Armaedi citizen or no, you're only human. And no human can ever hope to match a Ghualloc...

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go East->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go South->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go West->The Bad Ending]]
passages.name: Hamlet 3

passages.text:
You are standing at a fork in the road. In front of you is three ways to go: To the left to a quaint little Hamlet, to the right a foreboding Fortress, and lastly the way from whence you came. 

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Fork.]]
[[Go East->Fortress]]
[[Go South->Castle]]
[[Go West->Village]]
passages.name: The Fork.

passages.text:
The fortress looms above you, it's impassable stone face stares deeply into your soul. You look back, unblinking.

Before you lies two equally broad oak doors, complete with black steel trim. Both doors are seemingly unguarded and both have their own respective drawbridges with a moat. The doors are equidistant from you and there is one to your Left, and one to your Right.

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->Fortress]]
[[Go East->Right Door]]
[[Go South->The Fork.]]
[[Go West->Left Door]]
passages.name: Fortress

passages.text:
The way from whence you came always seem to shock. The majestic castle of the Armaedi empire stands before you from where you are a Knight. A knight that stands in the Holy Order no less. 

No beast or man can hope to stand against them, and your gods be with them if they shall try.

Yet... it seems like some are?

You notice a black hoard already at the gates as you prepare to leap into action. 

It's time to put your money where your mouth is. 

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->Action]]
[[Go East->Action]]
[[Go South->Action]]
[[Go West->Action]]
passages.name: Castle

passages.text:
A quaint little Hamlet stands before you.

Or it should! They're being ravaged by black beasts!

It's time to leap into action, as a Holy Knight you cannot sit idly by!

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->Ghuallocs]]
[[Go East->Ghuallocs]]
[[Go South->Ghuallocs]]
[[Go West->Ghuallocs]]
passages.name: Village

passages.text:
As you step onto the wooden bridge on the right, the gate starts to rise before you.

From which out steps a gigantic dragon, with flames dancing around it's maw. A single scale on the beast is the size of your hand, and it's color blazes a red so much more crimson yet still more vibrant then the color of your own blood.

Child's play. Reall you don't get the average peasants fascination with such creatures. Knowing you must fast, also works at a disadvantage for the dragon. As it lunges at you with it's claw you easily sideswipe the best and cut it's head clean off, your enchanted blade barely even nicked.

Now, the splintry door gives way with a mighty thud, and you walk into a short entrance way with two doors. Based off the trap before, it'd be wise to careful consider which way to go. However, the doors are completely alike, and wiht no distinguish between them it's almost completely random.


(Please enter East or West to continue.)

[[Go East->Right Door 2]]
[[Go West->Left Door 2]]
passages.name: Right Door

passages.text:
As you approach the left door you feel something start to itch along your arms as soon as you step on it's bridge. 

Fire.

You recognize the tells almost immediately. Luckily you were prepared for this purpose. All knights of the Holy Order are covered by elemtnal spells. This fire cannot claim you today.

As you approach the door you notice the burnt piles of ash of that surround the entrance way. It seems not many have had such luck as you.
However, you will not be stopped this day.

The splintry door gives way with a mighty thud, and you walk into a short entrance way with two doors. Based off the trap before, it'd be wise to careful consider which way to go. However, the doors are completely alike, and wiht no distinguish between them it's almost completely random.

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go East->Right Door 1]]
[[Go West->Left Door 1]]
passages.name: Left Door

passages.text:
Why there must be mountains of treaure in here, heaps upon heaps of it! The original owener must never have suspected anyone to get past their traps! 

Why there must be enough here to pay off your debts to the order! Now begins your life as a free man, free from the burden of duty...

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Good Ending]]
[[Go East->The Good Ending]]
[[Go South->The Good Ending]]
[[Go West->The Good Ending]]
passages.name: Right Door 1

passages.text:
The door opens with ease but you notice too little too late that before you is a trap!

You stumble and trip on a tripwire set before you, falling headfirst into a vat of acid. 

The searing pain  flares your body as soon the cold enevlops you, leaving no sign of you except for your enchanted armor...

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go East->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go South->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go West->The Bad Ending]]
passages.name: Left Door 1

passages.text:
The door opens with ease but you notice too little too late that before you is a trap!

You stumble and trip on a tripwire set before you, falling headfirst into a vat of acid. 

The searing pain  flares your body as soon the cold enevlops you, leaving no sign of you except for your enchanted armor...

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go East->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go South->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go West->The Bad Ending]]
passages.name: Right Door 2

passages.text:
Why there must be mountains of treaure in here, heaps upon heaps of it! The original owener must never have suspected anyone to get past their traps! 

Why there must be enough here to pay off your debts to the order! Now begins your life as a free man, free from the burden of duty...


(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Good Ending]]
[[Go East->The Good Ending]]
[[Go South->The Good Ending]]
[[Go West->The Good Ending]]
passages.name: Left Door 2

passages.text:
Ghuallocs. 

Bah, these horrid creatures always leave a bad taste in your mouth. Luckily, they are no match for your enchanted sword. 

You cleave through the horde with ease. Bashing and smashing through the black beasts to repel the invasion. Monotonous work, yet critical if the bulwarks are to hold.

However, a Holy Knight should always be able to stand up to Ghuallocs, a million to one. This is almost like sweeping out the training rooms back at the academy.

Where are your fellow knights? Gone, on critical missions. For how resource intensive you are, there is only a handful and so the order assigns you to each country, or in your case empire, based off of skill and deservability. The order operates independetly at the heart of the world, and as such you belong to the order.

That is till you realize, there are no more Ghuallocs to kill, your duty now down. The black masses huddled lifeless before you, you start to hear some clapping.

Out comes the Armaedi Emperor through the bruised gate, with a joyous look on his face, one you've never managed to see before.

"Brilliant! Magnificient! Amazing! You deserve nothing but the best, why you were an absolute hurricane" 

You realize you're standing there dumbfounded and quickly bow with respect.

"Psh, enough of that, your time with that blasted order is over. Please become my head magistrate at once. I must have such a skille dwarrior in my eploy, no matter the cost!"

Having no reason to reject the offer, it seems like your life is about to change...

(Please enter a a vertical or horizontal direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Good Ending]]
[[Go East->The Bad Ending]]
[[Go South->The Good Ending]]
[[Go West->The Bad Ending]]
passages.name: Action

passages.text:
Ghuallocs. 

Bah, these horrid creatures always leave a bad taste in your mouth. Luckily, they are no match for your enchanted sword.

Still, you must attack and finish off these creatures. So you unseathe your blade making short work of them, and saving the village in the process.

As a reward for your bravery the village decides to have a feast for you. Sometimes being a Holy Knight isn't so bad...

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->The Good Ending]]
[[Go East->The Good Ending]]
[[Go South->The Good Ending]]
[[Go West->The Good Ending]]
passages.name: Ghuallocs

passages.text:
Congratulations!

One way or another you have succeeded in life?

Play again?

(Please enter a direction to continue.)

[[Go North->Fork]]
[[Go East->Fork]]
[[Go South->Fork]]
[[Go West->Fork]]
passages.name: The Good Ending
